Astronomers have discovered a world bigger than Jupiter, just Fifteen light-years from Earth, evidently a huge ball associated with gas with a floor temperature well under zero. Geoffrey Marcy, who mind a four-member team of San Francisco State experts, announced the discovery the week of June 25 at a scientific symposium throughout Canada. The finding was confirmed by a separate team throughout Switzerland. The group found the planet using the Keck My spouse and i telescope in Hawaii. It is huge mass : at least 1.9 times bigger than Jupiter's -- was detected by the wobble in the movement of a nearby star, not by direct visualization. There is no evidence of any solid find the planet on which Earth-like life forms might have designed. Scientists say the globe is mostly hydrogen and helium which has a surface temperature of about 80 degrees beneath zero. The planet had been the first to be found orbiting a small star referred to as Gliese 876, one-third the size of the sun. It really is one of the closest members of a class of low-mass megastars that are the most common in the Milky Way galaxy. The actual previously closest-known "extrasolar" planet orbits a star about 30 light-years away. A light-year is 5.9 billion dollars miles, the distance lighting travels in one 12 months. "It's not spitting distance, exactly, but spacecraft distance probably for future generations," Marcy said Wednesday. Marcy added that the discovery of a planet around Gliese 876 significantly raises the odds that numerous more planets may be found relatively close to our own solar program. "The key issue is that this is by far the lowest-mass legend around which a earth has ever been found out," he said. A dozen such planets have been discovered by the world's astronomers, which includes seven by Marcy and his associates in the past several years. A report on the latest discovery will be posted in the June 27 issue of Technology News. Hurricane Katrina is gone. However the disaster left in the wake continues to change. Public health officials are nevertheless scrambling to find stranded people and deal with the injured. From the immediate aftermath, assist workers are struggling to provide basic human needs: shelter, drinking water, foods, clothing, and sanitation.Also in short supply are the daily drugs needed by people with long-term illnesses such as diabetes mellitus and heart disease.Disasters are humbling events. The usa is big, rich, along with deep in sources. Yet the public wellness aftermath of Storm Katrina will continue for several days, weeks, months, along with years.What can all of us expect as time goes by? Contaminated Water Floodwaters inevitably tend to be contaminated with raw sewage. Even so, this kind of water is not particularly dangerous unless somebody drinks it as well as unless it gets to untreated wounds.Together with water systems inoperative, sanitation becomes very difficult. Side washing is the best strategy to prevent disease — nevertheless even hand cleansing is difficult in the absence of clean water. If available, alcohol-based palm sanitizers are very effective.And normal water can be disinfected. This can be done by boiling drinking water (a rolling boil for one minute) as well as, if boiling isn’t feasible, by disinfection (1/8 teaspoon unscented chlorine bleach every gallon of obvious water, 1/4 teaspoon for each gallon of non-sunny water; mix and let sit for 30 minutes).One often disregarded source of contamination is bottled water from hazardous sources.
